review: I'm currently using the Apple TV as a replacement for cable or satellite TV.  I'm currently running the Apple TV through a Pioneer AV receiver and a Samsung 65" LED TV.  I couldn't be happier with the Apple TV's picture quality.  The sound quality is also superior, but it is limited to a 5.1 output.Without cable, I'm using an off-air antenna to provide local channels and supplementing with Netflix and iTunes through the Apple TV.  I'm thinking about adding Hulu Plus as well.  I've used the built-in apps in my Samsung TV and a PS3 to stream Netflix before.  While I had good results using the PS3, I prefer to use the Apple TV.  The Apple TV also allows me to access iTunes, which is great for shows which are not on Netflix.  I'll gladly pay $40 for a season of a show that I want to watch vs paying $80+ every month to the cable company.When using iTunes, the picture is a full 1080p.  The streaming is very smooth and it takes almost no time to buffer.  My internet connection is through AT&T; U-Verse and is 18MBPS.I also subscribe to iTunes match, which allows me to play all of my music through the receiver which is hooked up to the Apple TV.  It also runs very smoothly and is fully controllable from my iPhone or iPad.  Additionally, I often stream Pandora from my iPhone via AirPlay through the Apple TV.  The Apple TV even displays the album cover art when listening to Pandora in this fashion.Overall, I'd say it's an excellent replacement for cable.  The setup was easy (HDMI cable hookup and the software walks you through getting it connected to your WiFi).Pros - Excellent quality picture and sound, full access to the Apple universe, streams/mirrors iPhone, iPod, and iPad, easy setup, great Netflix interface.Cons - Limited to 5.1 surround sound, can't download apps (as of yet).

review: I bought the Apple TV for my parents who love watching shows/movies on Netflix, but don't have a game consol/wifi capable dvd player that allow streaming.  Apple Tv is great for all them because it is so simple and what it does, it does great.The apps that work with Apple TV are great, my favorites are HBOGo and Netflix, but the ability to wirelessly stream any apple device to the TV is Apple TV's best function in my opinion.Now for a couple negatives. the apps on the device are great but there could be more. You have to purchase an HDMI cord or digital optical cords separately.A few little complaints aside, Apple TV is a great way to stream movies, shows, or music through your TV via apps or your own Apple devices.
